title: Making Age of Empires: Definitive Edition

json.text: The Definitive Edition started with looking at something that was already going on.
A small group of kind of passionate guys at the Age 2 community were working on an unofficial
expansion for Age of Empires 2.
I actually remember the very first goal we had when we released the first mod.
Like, I want twenty thousand downloads.
That was my goal.
And we hit that after two hours and one crashed website.
I played that and I saw the love was there.
It was so good as basically a mod that we ended up publishing them.
That was sort of the beginning of this revival.
With Definitive Edition we're going back to the very beginning.
Every Age of Empires game except Age of Empires One has seen an extra boost given in the last
few years.
It needed the refreshment.
For us it was a really easy call.
We've got a group of super talented developers and we've got this great game that people
still love.
What can we do to modernize it, to bring it into now.
The big piece was visuals I would say.
Everything has been remade from scratch.
It's shockingly good on the art side and the music is beautiful.
Microsoft went out to Prague and got a proper symphony orchestra.
And they redid several track with a symphony orchestra, which is great.
It takes all those Age melodies that you remember and just blows the doors off of it.
We had to make a lot of gameplay changes as well cause the game, it saw such a big improvement
from Age one to Age Two that if you now go back it really feels old.
We've addressed nearly all of the games' shortcomings.
So the series is now cohesive which is a wonderful achievement.
We took what was already pretty incredible and just made it even better.
Five years ago I was working at a restaurant and I was still playing Age of Empires like
once in a while and I started to dabble around in modding.
I was like, okay, I have ideas, but I can't make graphics, I can't make sounds.
Then we started sourcing from the community, and saying 'hey, want to help out a bit?'
With Forgotten Empires, this awesome group of Age fans made these additions they literally
made on their own called 'The Forgotten.'
What's great about age is that you just have so much passion throughout the world that
you can find where passions kind of coupled with talent, and you just get some really
special people.
The most rabid fans of the series getting together.
A modding team pooling their talent to form a full-fledged developer.
I think the passion of the fans making something that cohesive surprised me.
I think the Forgotten Empires guys, with their campaigns, they were just as good as the Ensemble
campaigns.
That's a testament to their dedication, and I think that's rare.
I think they took a calculated risk in partnering with us, and allowing us to be stewards of
the franchise.
Most important for us was there's a team that we can work with that has that same passion,
still believe in this product and want to make it new again.
When I started with the Age of Empires series in 1996 I never in my wildest dreams thought
that twenty-one years late I would be working on the same game, the same code-base.
It is a timeless franchise and it's proven that already.
This moment of time, the rebirth of Age of Empires One and this Definitive Edition for
the twentieth anniversary, I think is just the beginning of a much longer journey that
we're about to embark on.
